did.abstract: The Conrad Firestein Photographs contain one photographic print of the late photographer John Albok, shot circa 1982.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Conrad Firestein is an Amsterdam-based photographer whose portfolio documents fashion, beauty, lifestyles, and interiors from the late-20th century through the present. The subject of Firesteinâ€™s collection, the late John Albok, was a celebrated tailor and photographer best known for his images of New York shot during the Great Depression.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The Conrad Firestein Photographs were rehoused in February 2013.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The Conrad Firestein Photographs were arranged by an archivist within a single folder.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Conrad Firestein Photographs; PHOTOS 194; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
acqinfo.p: Conrad Firestein sent a gift of one photograph of John Albok accession on January 7, 2005. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 2005.042 and NPA.2005.008.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Conrad Firestein are held by Conrad Firestein. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Conrad Firestein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Conrad Firestein Photographs contain an 8"x10" black and white fiber-based portrait of the late tailor and photographer John Albok.
